text: The 60 metres event at the 1922 Women's World Games took place in Paris at the Stade Pershing on 20 August 1922. Eight athletes from four nations participated in the 100 yards. Both the heats and the final took place during during the afternoon session. Czechoslovak Marie Mejzlikova II won the final in a time of 7.6 seconds, ahead of the British women Mary Lines and Nora Callebout. ==Results== ===Heats=== The heats consisted of two series, where best two athletes of each heat continued to the final. ====Heat 1==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Mary Lines 7.8 sec WR, Q 2 Marie Mejzlikova II Q 3 Germaine Robin 4 Mabel Gilliland ====Heat 2==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Nora Callebout 8.0 sec Q 2 Q 3 Camelia Sabie 4 Source: ===Final=== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes Marie Mejzlikova II 7.6 sec Mary Lines 7.7 sec Nora Callebout 7.8 sec 4 7.8 sec Source: ==References== ==Other websites== *Newspaper image of the final Category:1922 Women's World Games
